item.title: Querying Chef REST Api With pure Ruby
item.description: If you want to talk to the chef API without using some wrapper like Ridley, knife, etc.., this is how you do it: Note: This is taken from here but modified to use httparty {% highlight ruby %} require ‘base64’ require ‘time’ require ‘digest/sha1’ require ‘openssl’ require ‘net/https’ require ‘json’ require ‘pry’ require ‘httparty’ class ChefAPI # Public: Gets/Sets the String path for the HTTP request. attr_accessor :path # Public: Gets/Sets the String client_name containing the Chef client name.
